Kent Weigle,
[[Rafael Arutunian]] | formercoach =Stephanee Grosscup
Karel Kovar | choreographer =Genia Chernyshova,
Stephanee Grosscup | formerchoreographer = | skating club =Oval Skating Club | former skating club =Salt Lake Figure Skating | currenttraininglocations = | formertraininglocations = | beganskating = | retired = | combined total = | combined date = | SP score = | SP date = | FS score = | FS date = | medaltemplates = }} '''Nathan Chen''' (born May 5, 1999) is an American [[Figure skating|figure skater]]. He is a two-time (2010, 2011) U.S. novice men's champion. By winning the novice gold medal at age 10 in 2010, Chen became the youngest national novice champion in the United States. His 2011 total winning score of 163.40 makes him the highest scoring U.S. national novice champion under the [[ISU Judging System]].{{cite news | url = http://www.goldenskate.com/articles/2010/us_nov_ml.shtml | title = Nathan Chen makes history in Greensboro | first = Elvin | last = Walker | date = January 24, 2011 | accessdate = July 4, 2011 | work = GoldenSkate }} == Career == Chen won consecutive national novice titles at the [[2010 United States Figure Skating Championships#Novice men|2010]]{{cite news | url = http://web.icenetwork.com/news/article.jsp?ymd=20100119&content_id=7935174&vkey=ice_news | title = Chen wins novice men's title in Spokane | first = Mickey | last = Brown | date = January 19, 2010 | accessdate = July 4, 2011 | work = IceNetwork }} and [[2011 United States Figure Skating Championships#Novice men|2011 U.S. Championships]].{{cite news | url = http://web.icenetwork.com/news/article.jsp?ymd=20110124&content_id=16493980&vkey=ice_news | title = Chen repeats as novice men's champion | first = Mickey | last = Brown | date = January 24, 2011 | accessdate = July 4, 2011 | work = IceNetwork }} For the 2011â12 season, Chen will move up to the junior level in national competitions but is not old enough to do so internationally. He is coached by [[Evgenia Chernyshova|Genia Chernyshova]] and also travels to [[Lake Arrowhead, California]] to work with jump specialist [[Rafael Arutunian]].{{cite news | url = http://www.ifsmagazine.com/articles/558-nathan-chen-young-star-on-the-rise | title = Nathan Chen: Young Star On The Rise | first = Elvin | last = Walker | date = July 3, 2011 | accessdate = July 4, 2011 | work = International Figure Skating }} Chen has qualified from the Pacific Coast Sectional Championships in November 2011 to compete in the 2012 Prudential U.S. Figure Skating Championships, to be held from January 22 - 29, 2012 in San Jose, CA. == Personal life == Nathan Chen is the youngest of five siblings in his family. He began figure skating at three years old. In addition to figure skating, he has been training and performing in ballet with [[Ballet West]] Academy [http://www.balletwest.org/Academy/ Ballet West Academy]since six years old. He also enjoys playing the piano and competing in youth hockey. Chen has been enrolled in the Extended Learning Program (ELP)[http://www.slc.k12.ut.us/depts/learningsvcs/special/extlearning/ SLCSD Extended Learning Program] of the Salt Lake City School District since kindergarten. == Programs == {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |- ! [http://www.usfigureskating.org/leaderboard/results/2010/64740/SEGM022.html Free skate] |} == Honors == *Recipient of 2011 Athlete Alumni Ambassador Award{{cite news | url = http://web.icenetwork.com/news/article.jsp?ymd=20110516&content_id=19132036&vkey=ice_pressrelease | title = Chen named winner of annual 3A award | first = | last = |date = May 16, 2011 | work = [[U.S. Figure Skating]] | publisher = IceNetwork | accessdate = June 18, 2011}} *Recipient of 2011, 2010 Cecilia Colledge Memorial Fund award[http://web.icenetwork.com/news/article.jsp?ymd=20110202&content_id=16555292&vkey=ice_pressrelease Cecilia Colledge Memorial Fund] *Winner of 2011, 2010, and 2009 Michael Weiss Foundation Scholarship[http://www.michaelweiss.org/2011winners.htm 2011 Michael Weiss Foundation Scholarship winners!] *Recipient of 2010, 2009, and 2008 U.S. Figure Skating Memorial Fund[http://www.usfigureskating.org/Athletes.asp?id=340 U.S. Figure Skating Memorial Fund] *Member of the 2010-11, 2011-12 U.S. Figure Skating Team Envelope C[http://www.usfigureskating.org/Athletes.asp?id=209# U.S. Figure Skating Team Envelope C] *Featured as [[ABC World News]]' "Person-of-the-Week" on February 19, 2010JOHN BERMAN, WONBO WOO and CHRISTINE BROZYNA, [http://abcnews.go.com/WN/person-week-nathan-chen/story?id=9889538 Person of the Week: Nathan Chen], ''ABC World News'', February 19, 2010 *Performed in the WiWa Ice Shows in Hangzhou, China, May 1â5, 2010Susan D. [http://www.ifsmagazine.com/articles/585-skate-asia-2011/ Skate Asia 2011]The International Figure Skating Magazine, July 26, 2011 == Videos == *[http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gCUUdfT_CY0 âHungarian Rhapsodyâ free skate at 2010 Broadmoor Open] *[http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MRHimaaLOYg âPeter and the Wolfâ exhibition at 2010 Smucker's Skating Spectacular] == Reference == {{Reflist|1}} == External links == * [http://www.freewebs.com/nathan_chen/ Official Website] {{Persondata | NAME = Chen, Nathan | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = May 5, 1999 | PLACE OF BIRTH = Salt Lake City | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Chen, Nathan}} [[Category:American male single skaters]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:1999 births]] {{us-figure-skating-bio-stub}}
